description: Master array fundamentals including contiguous memory allocation O(1) random access by index fixed size or dynamic resizing. Essential for storing collections sequential data linear data structures. Learn indexing traversal insertion deletion searching sorting operations. Foundation for all data structure algorithms and most interview problems.

resources.title: Striver - Two Pointer & Sliding Window (pattern intro)

description: Master two-pointer technique for efficient O(n) array traversal using left and right pointer convergence. Essential pattern for sorted array problems like 3Sum, pair finding, palindrome validation, container with most water, and removing duplicates. Learn simultaneous bidirectional scanning, collision detection, and optimization strategies. Critical for technical interviews and competitive programming.

resources.title: NeetCode - Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters (sliding window example)
LeetCode  Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters

description: Master sliding window pattern for O(n) subarray and substring optimization. Learn fixed-size and variable-size windows for maximum sum subarray, longest substring problems, minimum window substring, and permutation in string. Understand expand-shrink technique, two-pointer window bounds, and deque-based sliding window maximum. Essential for Amazon, Google interviews.

resources.title: Striver - Prefix Sum / Product of Array Except Self (concept video)
NeetCode - Product of Array Except Self (walkthrough)
LeetCode  Product of Array Except Self

description: Master prefix sum and suffix arrays for O(1) range query computation after O(n) preprocessing. Essential for product of array except self, range sum queries, subarray sum problems, and equilibrium index. Learn cumulative sum patterns, difference arrays, and 2D prefix matrices. Critical for optimization and dynamic programming problems.

Master array searching algorithms: linear search O(n) for unsorted arrays and binary search O(log n) for sorted arrays. Learn search variants including first/last occurrence, peak element finding, and search in rotated arrays. Understand divide-and-conquer paradigm, mid calculation (avoiding overflow), and boundary conditions. Foundation for binary search pattern.

Master fundamental sorting algorithms: quicksort O(n log n) average, merge sort O(n log n) stable, heapsort O(n log n) in-place, and O(n²) algorithms like bubble, insertion, selection sort. Learn stability, in-place sorting, partitioning schemes (Lomuto, Hoare), and when to use each algorithm. Essential for interval merging, scheduling, and preprocessing for binary search.

Master hashing for O(1) average-time lookup, insertion, and deletion using hash tables, hash maps (dict/HashMap), and hash sets. Essential for two sum, frequency counting, anagrams, longest consecutive sequence, and duplicate detection. Learn collision handling, load factors, and space-time tradeoffs. Critical pattern for 90% of array interview problems.

Master subarray problems using Kadane's algorithm for maximum subarray sum, sliding window for variable-length subarrays, and prefix sum with hashing for subarray sum equals K. Learn contiguous subsequence patterns, cumulative frequency techniques, and dynamic programming on subarrays. Essential for optimization problems and Meta, Amazon interviews.

Master 2D array and matrix operations: spiral traversal, 90-degree rotation, matrix search in sorted 2D arrays, and diagonal traversal. Learn in-place rotation algorithms, layer-by-layer processing, binary search on 2D matrices, and coordinate transformations. Essential for image processing, game boards, and Google, Microsoft interviews.

Master greedy algorithms on arrays for interval scheduling, activity selection, jump game, and minimum platforms problems. Learn sorting-based greedy strategies, locally optimal choices leading to global optimum, and proving correctness. Understand when greedy works versus dynamic programming. Essential for scheduling and optimization interview problems.

resources.title: Striver - Trapping Rain Water (concept & monotonic stacks)

description: Master advanced array patterns including trapping rainwater using two-pointer or monotonic stack, Boyer-Moore majority voting, Dutch national flag partitioning, next permutation algorithm. Learn advanced techniques like coordinate compression, range queries, and in-place array manipulation. Essential for FAANG interviews combining multiple patterns. Tests deep array algorithm mastery.

Master linked list fundamentals including node structure with data and next pointer, dynamic memory allocation, O(1) insertion deletion at known positions. Essential for dynamic size collections sequential access when random access not needed. Learn singly versus doubly linked lists, traversal patterns, memory management. Foundation for queues, stacks, graphs, and pointer-based algorithms.

resources.title: Striver - Insert & Delete in Linked List

description: Master singly linked list operations: insertion (head, tail, position), deletion (value, position), traversal, and searching in O(n). Learn pointer manipulation, dummy node technique, and edge case handling (empty list, single node). Essential foundation for reversal, cycle detection, and merge operations. Critical for understanding pointer-based data structures.

resources.title: LeetCode  Flatten a Multilevel Doubly Linked List

description: Master doubly linked list with bidirectional traversal using both prev and next pointers. Learn O(1) insertion/deletion at both ends, reverse traversal, and LRU cache implementation. Understand advantages over singly linked lists for browser history, undo/redo functionality, and deque operations. Essential for cache design problems.

Master circular linked lists where tail->next points to head, forming continuous loop structure. Essential for round-robin scheduling, Josephus problem, and circular buffer implementation. Learn cycle detection, circular traversal without null checks, and split circular list operations. Understand when circular structure provides algorithmic advantages.

Master linked list reversal in O(n) time and O(1) space using iterative three-pointer technique: prev, curr, next. Learn recursive reversal approach with O(n) stack space. Essential for reverse nodes in k-groups, palindrome list detection, and reordering lists. Most frequently asked linked list interview question at FAANG companies.

resources.title: Striver - Detect Loop in Linked List (Tortoise & Hare)
GFG - Detect Loop in Linked List

description: Master Floyd cycle detection algorithm (tortoise and hare) using slow and fast pointers to detect loops in O(n) time O(1) space. Slow moves one step fast moves two steps collision indicates cycle. Essential for finding cycle start node cycle length loop removal. Common in linked list problems duplicate number detection happy number. Most elegant two-pointer pattern.

resources.title: GFG - Find Middle of Linked List
LeetCode  Middle of the Linked List

description: Master finding middle of linked list in O(n) time and O(1) space using slow-fast pointer technique. Slow moves one step, fast moves two steps; when fast reaches end, slow is at middle. Essential for merge sort on linked lists, palindrome detection, and list partitioning. Learn handling even versus odd length lists.

resources.title: Striver - Merge Two Sorted Linked Lists
GFG - Merge Two Sorted Linked Lists

description: Master merging two sorted linked lists in O(m+n) time maintaining sorted order using sequential node comparison. Learn iterative with dummy node versus recursive merge approaches. Essential foundation for merge sort on linked lists and merging K sorted lists. Common Microsoft, Amazon interview question requiring pointer manipulation skills.

resources.title: Striver - Remove Nth Node from End
GFG - Remove Nth Node from End
LeetCode  Remove Nth Node From End of List

description: Master removing nth node from end in O(n) time and O(1) space using two-pointer technique with n-step gap. Learn dummy node technique for edge cases (removing head) and one-pass algorithms. Essential pattern for list manipulation and understanding pointer gap techniques. Frequently asked at Google, Facebook interviews.

resources.title: Striver - Intersection of Two Linked Lists
NeetCode - Intersection of Two Linked Lists
LeetCode  Intersection of Two Linked Lists

description: Master finding intersection point of two linked lists in O(m+n) time and O(1) space using length difference alignment or two-pointer convergence technique. Learn detecting if lists intersect, finding intersection node, and understanding Y-shaped list merging. Essential for graph-like linked list problems and pointer arithmetic.

Master rotating linked list right by k positions in O(n) time by forming circular list and breaking at (length - k % length) position. Learn handling edge cases (k > length, k = 0) and optimizing with modulo operation. Essential for list manipulation and understanding circular list conversion techniques.

topic: Flatten Linked List / Advanced LL Patterns

resources.title: LeetCode  Flatten a Multilevel Doubly Linked List

description: Master flattening multilevel linked lists using DFS recursion or iterative stack-based approaches. Learn handling child pointers, preserving sorted order in vertical flattening, and pointer reconnection strategies. Essential for complex linked list manipulation and tree-to-list conversions. Advanced pointer manipulation problem for senior interviews.

Master stack data structure with LIFO (Last In First Out) ordering and O(1) push pop peek operations. Essential for expression evaluation parentheses matching backtracking function call simulation and DFS traversal. Learn array-based versus linked-list implementation overflow underflow handling. Foundation for recursion simulation and parsing algorithms.

Master parentheses matching using stack to validate balanced brackets braces parentheses in O(n) time. Push opening symbols pop and match with closing symbols. Essential for expression validation compiler design HTML XML parsing. Learn handling multiple bracket types detecting mismatched pairs. Most common beginner stack interview problem.

Master monotonic stack pattern for finding next greater element next smaller element previous greater smaller in O(n) time. Learn maintaining increasing or decreasing stack order for optimal element finding. Essential for stock span trapping rainwater largest rectangle in histogram. Critical advanced stack pattern for competitive programming interviews.

Master designing min stack with O(1) push pop top getMin operations. Learn two-stack approach main plus min versus single-stack encoding technique for space optimization. Essential system design problem testing data structure design skills. Common Amazon Microsoft interview question for understanding tradeoffs constant-time constraints.

Master implementing stack using queues to simulate LIFO using FIFO structures. Learn costly push O(n) with cheap pop O(1) versus costly pop O(n) with cheap push O(1) approaches. Understand data structure conversion algorithm tradeoffs when to use each strategy. Tests understanding of fundamental data structure properties.

Master largest rectangle in histogram using monotonic increasing stack in O(n) time. For each bar, pop taller bars calculating areas using them as height. Hard problem combining monotonic stack with area calculation. Essential for maximal rectangle in matrix understanding stack-based optimization. Classic hard interview problem testing advanced stack skills and geometric thinking.

resources.title: Striver - Introduction to Stack & Queue (Queue basics included)

description: Master queue data structure with FIFO (First In First Out) ordering and O(1) enqueue dequeue operations. Essential for BFS traversal level-order tree traversal task scheduling printer spooling. Learn array-based circular queue versus linked-list implementation. Foundation for breadth-first algorithms and real-world queuing systems.

Master circular queue using modulo arithmetic for wrap-around indexing to efficiently use fixed array space. Learn handling full versus empty conditions avoiding array shifting implementing with front rear pointers. Essential for ring buffers producer-consumer problems memory-efficient queue implementations. Tests understanding of modular indexing.

resources.title: Striver - Queue Using Stacks (Two Stack Method)

description: Master implementing queue using two stacks achieving amortized O(1) for enqueue and dequeue. Learn input stack for enqueue output stack for dequeue with lazy transfer strategy. Understand amortized analysis data structure conversion LIFO-to-FIFO transformation. Common interview question testing algorithmic thinking amortized complexity.

Master implementing stack using one or two queues to simulate LIFO behavior with FIFO data structures. Learn making push costly O(n) versus making pop costly O(n) based on requirements. Understand queue rotation technique for reversing order. Tests deep understanding of stack versus queue properties and data structure conversion.

resources.title: LeetCode  Kth Largest Element in a Stream

description: Master priority queue using binary heap for O(log n) insertion deletion of min max element. Essential for Dijkstra shortest path A-star search top K elements merge K sorted lists task scheduling by priority. Learn heap property heapify operations and applications. Critical data structure for greedy algorithms graph problems.

resources.title: NeetCode - Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
LeetCode  Binary Tree Level Order Traversal

description: Master using queues for BFS traversal on graphs and level-order traversal on trees. Learn processing nodes level-by-level shortest path in unweighted graphs connected components. Essential for tree right side view zigzag traversal graph problems. Understand why FIFO property makes queues perfect for breadth-first exploration.

Master recursion fundamentals including base case recursive case stack frame execution and call stack visualization. Essential foundation for divide-and-conquer backtracking tree traversal and dynamic programming. Learn identifying recursive structure avoiding stack overflow understanding time space complexity of recursive algorithms. Critical thinking pattern for all advanced algorithms.

Master recursion tree visualization for analyzing recursive algorithms time complexity calculation. Learn drawing recursion trees counting nodes per level calculating total work done. Essential for understanding merge sort quick sort fibonacci recursion analysis. Foundation for solving recurrence relations and Master theorem application.

Master recursion on arrays for problems like reversing printing subsets permutations and combinations. Learn recursive traversal patterns base case identification state passing through parameters. Essential for subset generation combination sum array partition problems. Foundation for backtracking and dynamic programming on arrays.

resources.title: LeetCode  Letter Combinations of a Phone Number

description: Master backtracking fundamentals for constraint satisfaction problems using recursive exploration with undo. Essential for N-Queens Sudoku maze solving combination generation. Learn pruning techniques decision tree exploration state space search. Critical pattern for exhaustive search problems requiring all solutions or optimal solution.

Master generating all subsets (power set) using include exclude recursive branching in O(2^n) time. Learn bit manipulation versus backtracking approaches for subset generation. Essential for combination sum partition problems subset queries. Foundation for understanding exponential time complexity and combinatorial enumeration.

Master generating all permutations using swapping or building sequences recursively in O(n!) time. Learn backtracking with used array versus swap-based permutation generation. Essential for arrangement problems scheduling permutation-based optimization. Critical for understanding factorial complexity and permutation algorithms.

Master combination sum problems using recursive exploration with repetition or without repetition. Learn target-based backtracking pruning negative branches include exclude decision making. Essential for coin change subset sum partition problems. Critical DP foundation and backtracking pattern for optimization problems.

Master recursion on strings for palindrome checking reversal subsequence generation pattern matching. Learn string slicing versus index-based recursion character-by-character processing. Essential for edit distance longest common subsequence string manipulation problems. Foundation for string dynamic programming.

Master N-Queens backtracking problem using constraint checking and recursive placement. Learn column diagonal anti-diagonal conflict detection efficient state representation bitmasking optimization. Classic hard backtracking problem testing constraint satisfaction skills. Essential for understanding backtracking pruning and optimization.

Master Sudoku solver using backtracking with row column box constraint validation. Learn efficient cell selection strategies pruning techniques constraint propagation. Classic constraint satisfaction problem requiring systematic search and validation. Tests advanced backtracking skills and optimization techniques.

Master Rat in Maze pathfinding using DFS backtracking for grid navigation with obstacles. Learn 4-directional movement visited tracking dead-end detection path recording. Essential grid-based backtracking problem for understanding maze solving algorithms. Foundation for robot navigation and grid traversal problems.

Master converting recursive solutions with overlapping subproblems to dynamic programming using memoization. Learn identifying optimal substructure overlapping subproblems state definition. Essential transition from recursion to DP for optimization problems. Foundation for all dynamic programming patterns and techniques.

resources.title: LeetCode  Letter Combinations of a Phone Number

description: Master backtracking fundamentals for exploring decision trees with undo capability. Essential for constraint satisfaction problems N-Queens Sudoku combinations permutations. Learn choice exploration pruning backtrack state restoration. Critical pattern for exhaustive search requiring all valid solutions or optimal solution finding.

Master generating all subsets power set using include exclude backtracking in O(2^n) time space. Learn recursive versus iterative bit manipulation approaches for subset enumeration. Essential for combination sum partition equal subset problems. Foundation for combinatorial generation and subset-based optimization problems.

Master subset generation with duplicates using sorting and skip logic to avoid duplicate subsets. Learn when to skip duplicate elements maintaining lexicographic order efficient pruning. Essential for combination sum II three sum avoiding repeated combinations. Critical for handling duplicate elements in backtracking problems.

Master permutation generation using backtracking with swap technique or used array tracking. Learn generating all arrangements in O(n!) time factorial complexity analysis. Essential for next permutation string permutations arrangement problems. Critical for understanding permutation algorithms and optimization.

Master unique permutation generation with duplicates using frequency map or sort-skip technique. Learn avoiding duplicate permutations maintaining lexicographic order. Essential for permutations II palindrome permutation problems with repeated elements. Critical for handling duplicates in permutation generation.

Master combination sum allowing element reuse using recursive exploration with sorted candidates. Learn target-based pruning early termination include exclude decisions. Essential for coin change unbounded knapsack problems. Foundation for understanding unbounded resource selection and optimization.

Master combination sum without element reuse generating unique combinations using each element once. Learn candidate sorting duplicate skipping ensuring uniqueness. Essential for subset sum problems with constraints. Critical pattern for bounded resource selection with duplicate handling.

Master N-Queens classic backtracking problem placing queens with no conflicts using constraint checking. Learn column diagonal anti-diagonal tracking bitmasking for optimization. Hardest standard backtracking problem testing constraint satisfaction skills. Essential for understanding advanced pruning techniques.

Master Sudoku solver using backtracking with row column 3x3 box constraint validation. Learn empty cell selection strategies constraint propagation pruning techniques. Classic NP-complete problem requiring systematic constraint checking. Tests advanced backtracking optimization skills.

Master Rat in Maze grid pathfinding using DFS backtracking with obstacle avoidance. Learn 4-directional movement visited array marking dead-end backtracking path recording. Essential grid traversal problem for robot navigation maze solving. Foundation for grid-based search algorithms.

Master Word Search in 2D grid using DFS backtracking with character matching and visited tracking. Learn directional exploration mark unmark pattern constraint satisfaction. Hard grid problem combining string matching with backtracking. Critical for board game algorithms and grid search.

resources.title: Striver - Letter Combinations of a Phone Number
LeetCode  Letter Combinations of a Phone Number

description: Master Letter Combinations of Phone Number using backtracking for Cartesian product generation. Learn digit-to-letters mapping iterative versus recursive approaches queue-based BFS. Essential for understanding product generation and multi-choice exploration. Common interview problem testing backtracking fundamentals.

Master binary search algorithm achieving O(log n) search in sorted arrays using divide-and-conquer. Essential for searching finding bounds optimization on answer space. Learn mid calculation avoiding overflow left right pointer updates boundary conditions. Foundation for logarithmic time algorithms and search space reduction.

Master binary search on sorted arrays handling corner cases like empty arrays single element duplicates. Learn iterative versus recursive implementation lower bound upper bound concepts. Essential for search insert position finding target ranges. Critical foundation for all binary search variants.

resources.title: NeetCode - First Bad Version (Boundary Binary Search)
GFG - Find First and Last Occurrence
LeetCode  Find First and Last Position of Element

description: Master finding first and last occurrence using modified binary search for range queries. Learn lower bound for first occurrence upper bound for last occurrence. Essential for finding element frequency ranges in sorted arrays. Common interview pattern for boundary finding problems.

Master lower bound and upper bound binary search for insertion point finding. Lower bound finds first position not less than target upper bound finds first position greater than target. Essential for range queries bisect operations sorted container manipulation. Foundation for interval-based problems.

topic: Binary Search in Rotated Sorted Array

resources.title: Striver - Search in Rotated Sorted Array
GFG - Search in Rotated Sorted Array
LeetCode  Search in Rotated Sorted Array

description: Master search in rotated sorted array by identifying sorted half and deciding search direction. Learn finding pivot point handling duplicates one-pass versus two-pass approaches. Essential for modified binary search understanding rotation patterns. Common Amazon Google interview question.

prerequisites: Binary Search in Rotated Sorted Array

resources.title: Striver - Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
GFG - Minimum Element in Rotated Array
LeetCode  Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array

description: Master finding minimum in rotated sorted array using binary search on rotation point. Learn identifying pivot comparing with bounds handling edge cases. Essential for understanding array rotation patterns modified search strategies. Foundation for rotated array problems.

Master peak element finding using binary search comparing with neighbors. Learn handling multiple peaks local maximum finding bitonic array search. Essential for mountain array problems understanding non-sorted binary search. Tests understanding of binary search on non-monotonic sequences.

resources.title: Striver - Binary Search on Answer Explained

description: Master binary search on answer space for minimization maximization problems. Learn identifying search space checking feasibility at midpoint. Essential for Koko eating bananas book allocation painter partition. Critical pattern for optimization problems with verification function.

Master book allocation and painter partition using binary search on answer. Learn minimizing maximum pages/time checking if allocation is possible with given constraints. Hard optimization problem combining binary search with greedy validation. Essential for resource allocation problems.

Master search in 2D matrix treating as flattened sorted array using binary search. Learn row-column index calculation matrix coordinates mapping. Essential for searching in row-wise column-wise sorted matrices. Common interview problem combining 2D arrays with binary search.

resources.title: Striver - Square Root Using Binary Search
GFG - Square Root Using Binary Search

description: Master computing integer square root using binary search on answer space from 1 to n. Learn mid squared comparison avoiding overflow precision handling. Essential for understanding binary search on mathematical functions. Common problem testing binary search on answer concept.

resources.title: Striver - Search in Infinite Sorted Array
GFG - Search in Infinite Sorted Array

description: Master binary search in unbounded infinite array using exponential search for range finding. Learn doubling search range then applying binary search. Essential for searching in infinite streams unbounded sequences. Advanced binary search application for unknown-size arrays.

Master string fundamentals including character arrays immutability concatenation substring operations. Essential for text processing pattern matching string manipulation. Learn ASCII Unicode encoding string comparison lexicographic ordering. Foundation for all string algorithms and text-based problems.

Master string reversal using two-pointer technique swapping characters from ends in O(n) time O(1) space. Learn in-place reversal iterative versus recursive approaches. Essential for palindrome checking sentence reversal. Common beginner string manipulation interview question.

Master anagram checking using character frequency counting or sorting in O(n) time. Learn hashmap approach versus sorting approach space-time tradeoffs. Essential for group anagrams valid anagram problems. Common interview question testing hashmap and string manipulation.

Master palindrome validation using two-pointer technique comparing characters from ends. Learn handling odd even length strings ignoring non-alphanumeric characters. Essential for longest palindrome substring palindrome partitioning. Foundation for palindrome-based string problems.

Master finding longest common prefix among strings using vertical scanning horizontal scanning. Learn character-by-character comparison early termination optimization. Essential for string grouping prefix matching trie applications. Common string manipulation interview problem.

Master finding longest palindromic substring using expand-around-center technique or dynamic programming. Learn handling odd even length palindromes center expansion in O(n²) time. Essential for palindrome problems understanding center-based expansion. Common medium string interview question.

resources.title: LeetCode  Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters

description: Master finding longest substring without repeating characters using sliding window with hashmap. Learn variable-size window character frequency tracking window expansion contraction. Essential pattern for substring problems. Most common sliding window string interview question.

Master Rabin-Karp algorithm for pattern matching using rolling hash in O(n+m) average time. Learn polynomial hashing hash collision handling modulo arithmetic. Essential for substring search multiple pattern matching. Foundation for string hashing techniques.

Master KMP (Knuth-Morris-Pratt) algorithm for pattern matching using prefix function LPS array. Learn O(n+m) pattern search avoiding redundant comparisons. Essential for substring search understanding failure function. Advanced string matching algorithm for competitive programming.

Master Z algorithm for pattern matching computing longest substring matching prefix. Learn Z-array construction linear-time pattern search. Essential for string matching problems understanding Z-function. Advanced alternative to KMP for pattern matching.

Master minimum window substring using sliding window with character frequency matching. Learn variable window with two pointers maintaining character counts. Hard string problem combining sliding window with hashmap. Essential for Amazon Facebook interviews.

Master string compression using run-length encoding counting consecutive characters. Learn in-place compression two-pointer technique character counting. Essential for data compression string manipulation. Common interview problem testing string processing skills.

resources.title: LeetCode  Maximum Depth of Binary Tree

description: Master binary tree fundamentals including node structure parent-child relationships tree properties like height depth. Essential for hierarchical data representation file systems DOM trees. Learn tree terminology root leaf internal nodes subtrees. Foundation for all tree-based algorithms and graph theory.

Master tree traversals inorder (left-root-right) preorder (root-left-right) postorder (left-right-root) using recursion. Essential for expression trees serialization tree reconstruction. Learn DFS traversal patterns stack-based iterative approaches. Foundation for tree algorithms and traversal-based problems.

resources.title: LeetCode  Binary Tree Level Order Traversal

description: Master level-order traversal using queue for BFS processing nodes level-by-level. Essential for tree width calculation level-wise operations shortest path in trees. Learn queue-based BFS tracking level boundaries NULL markers. Critical for breadth-first tree problems.

resources.title: LeetCode  Maximum Depth of Binary Tree

description: Master calculating tree height (max depth) using recursive DFS in O(n) time. Learn base case leaf handling comparing left right subtree heights. Essential for balanced tree checking diameter calculation. Foundation for tree metric calculations.

Master computing tree diameter (longest path between any two nodes) using DFS with height calculation. Learn combining height of left right subtrees updating global maximum. Essential for tree metrics understanding path calculations. Common tree interview problem.

Master checking balanced binary tree where left right subtree heights differ by at most 1. Learn recursive height calculation with balance checking optimization. Essential for AVL tree understanding tree balancing. Common interview problem testing recursive thinking.

Master path sum problems checking if root-to-leaf path sums to target using DFS. Learn recursive path tracking backtracking for all paths. Essential for tree path problems understanding DFS on trees. Foundation for path-based tree algorithms.

resources.title: LeetCode  Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree

description: Master finding lowest common ancestor (LCA) of two nodes using recursive DFS traversal. Learn detecting node presence in subtrees path-based LCA finding. Essential for tree queries understanding ancestor relationships. Common tree interview question.

Master zigzag level-order traversal alternating left-to-right and right-to-left per level. Learn using deque or reversing levels tracking direction. Essential for spiral tree traversal understanding bidirectional BFS. Medium difficulty tree problem.

resources.title: LeetCode  Vertical Order Traversal of a Binary Tree

description: Master vertical order traversal grouping nodes by column index using BFS with hashmap. Learn coordinate system column tracking sorting by row. Hard tree problem combining BFS with coordinate mapping. Tests understanding of 2D tree projection.

topic: Top View & Bottom View of Tree

resources.title: Striver - Top View of Binary Tree
LeetCode  Binary Tree Right Side View (closest match)

description: Master finding top view and bottom view of binary tree using vertical traversal with level tracking. Learn column-based grouping first visible node per column. Essential for tree projection problems understanding visibility. Common tree interview question.

topic: Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List

resources.title: LeetCode  Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List

description: Master flattening binary tree to linked list following preorder traversal using Morris threading. Learn in-place flattening recursive versus iterative approaches. Hard tree problem testing pointer manipulation. Essential for tree transformation problems.

Master binary search tree properties where left subtree less than root right subtree greater. Essential for efficient searching O(log n) average insertion deletion. Learn BST invariant inorder traversal gives sorted sequence. Foundation for ordered data structures.

resources.title: LeetCode  Search in a Binary Search Tree

description: Master searching in BST using binary search pattern comparing with current node. Learn O(log n) average O(n) worst case recursive versus iterative search. Essential for BST operations understanding search optimization. Foundation for BST algorithms.

resources.title: LeetCode  Insert into a Binary Search Tree

description: Master inserting into BST maintaining BST property using recursive or iterative approach. Learn finding insert position creating new leaf node. Essential for BST construction dynamic data insertion. Foundation for BST modification operations.

resources.title: LeetCode  Delete Node in a BST

description: Master deleting node from BST handling three cases: leaf one child two children. Learn inorder successor replacement maintaining BST property. Essential for BST modification understanding tree restructuring. Complex BST operation testing case analysis.

Master validating BST using range-based recursion or inorder traversal checking sorted order. Learn min-max bounds propagation detecting violations. Essential for BST verification understanding invariants. Common BST interview question.

resources.title: LeetCode  Lowest Common Ancestor of a BST

description: Master finding LCA in BST using BST property comparing node values with ancestors. Learn O(log n) search exploiting ordering property. Essential for BST queries optimization using structure. More efficient than general tree LCA.

resources.title: LeetCode  Kth Smallest Element in a BST

description: Master finding kth smallest element using inorder traversal with counter. Learn Morris traversal for O(1) space augmented BST with size. Essential for order statistics understanding inorder properties. Common BST interview question.

resources.title: LeetCode  Kth Largest Element in a Stream (Closest match)

description: Master finding kth largest element using reverse inorder traversal (right-root-left). Learn counter-based stopping augmented BST approach. Essential for order statistics reverse traversal patterns. Common variation of kth smallest problem.

Master finding inorder successor (next node in sorted order) and predecessor in BST. Learn case analysis using parent pointers or search-based approach. Essential for BST navigation understanding successor relationships. Common BST query problem.

resources.title: LeetCode  Floor/Ceil Equivalent (Closest: Search Insert Position)

description: Master finding floor (largest value less than or equal) and ceil (smallest value greater than or equal) in BST. Learn tracking potential candidates during search. Essential for range queries understanding BST bounds. Common BST search variant.

topic: BST to Sorted Doubly Linked List

resources.title: Striver - BST to Doubly Linked List
LeetCode  Convert BST to Sorted Circular DLL

description: Master converting BST to sorted doubly linked list using inorder traversal with pointer modification. Learn in-place conversion maintaining sorted order. Hard BST problem testing pointer manipulation. Essential for tree-to-list transformations.

Master recovering BST where two nodes are swapped using inorder traversal violation detection. Learn identifying swapped nodes restoring BST property. Hard BST problem testing inorder analysis. Essential for BST repair algorithms.

resources.title: Striver  Graph Representation (Adj List & Adj Matrix)

description: Master graph representations adjacency matrix O(V²) space O(1) edge lookup and adjacency list O(V+E) space efficient for sparse graphs. Essential for graph algorithms understanding tradeoffs. Learn directed versus undirected weighted versus unweighted graphs. Foundation for all graph problems.

Master depth-first search (DFS) using recursion or stack for graph traversal in O(V+E) time. Essential for connectivity cycle detection topological sort. Learn pre-order post-order timing visited tracking. Foundation for graph exploration algorithms.

resources.title: LeetCode  Shortest Path in Binary Matrix

description: Master breadth-first search (BFS) using queue for level-by-level graph traversal in O(V+E) time. Essential for shortest path in unweighted graphs level-wise processing. Learn distance tracking parent pointers. Foundation for shortest path algorithms.

Master finding connected components in undirected graph using DFS or BFS. Learn component counting labeling nodes by component. Essential for graph connectivity network analysis. Foundation for union-find applications.

resources.title: GFG  Detect Cycle in Undirected Graph

description: Master cycle detection in undirected graph using DFS with parent tracking. Learn avoiding false cycles through parent edge detecting back edges. Essential for graph validation tree checking. Common graph interview problem.

resources.title: GFG  Detect Cycle in Directed Graph

description: Master cycle detection in directed graph using DFS with recursion stack or colors. Learn detecting back edges in directed graphs. Essential for deadlock detection circular dependencies. Common directed graph problem.

Master topological sorting of directed acyclic graph (DAG) using DFS post-order or Kahn BFS algorithm. Essential for task scheduling dependency resolution build systems. Learn detecting cycles prerequisite ordering. Critical graph algorithm for scheduling.

Master Dijkstra algorithm for single-source shortest path in weighted graphs with non-negative weights using priority queue. Learn greedy selection relaxation technique O((V+E) log V) time. Essential for GPS navigation network routing. Most important shortest path algorithm.

resources.title: LeetCode  Cheapest Flights Within K Stops

description: Master Bellman-Ford algorithm for shortest path handling negative weights detecting negative cycles. Learn edge relaxation V-1 iterations O(VE) time. Essential for currency arbitrage understanding negative weights. Alternative to Dijkstra for negative edges.

resources.title: LeetCode  City With Smallest Number of Neighbors

description: Master Floyd-Warshall algorithm for all-pairs shortest path using dynamic programming in O(V³) time. Learn computing distances between all pairs handling negative weights. Essential for dense graphs understanding DP on graphs. Critical for complete distance matrix.

resources.title: LeetCode  Min Cost to Connect All Points

description: Master minimum spanning tree (MST) using Prim (greedy with priority queue) or Kruskal (union-find with sorting). Learn MST properties cut property cycle property. Essential for network design understanding greedy algorithms. Critical graph optimization problem.

Master union-find (disjoint set union) data structure with path compression and union by rank. Learn O(α(n)) amortized time for union and find operations. Essential for Kruskal MST cycle detection dynamic connectivity. Critical data structure for graph algorithms.

Master greedy algorithm paradigm making locally optimal choices leading to global optimum. Essential for activity selection Huffman coding Dijkstra. Learn greedy choice property optimal substructure proving correctness. Foundation for optimization algorithms when DP not needed.

Master activity selection problem choosing maximum non-overlapping activities using earliest finish time greedy strategy. Learn sorting by end time greedy choice correctness proof. Essential for interval scheduling meeting rooms. Foundation for greedy interval problems.

resources.title: LeetCode  Maximum Units on a Truck

description: Master fractional knapsack maximizing value using greedy value-to-weight ratio selection. Learn sorting by ratio taking fractions of items. Essential for resource optimization continuous knapsack. Different from 0-1 knapsack where greedy works.

resources.title: LeetCode  Minimum Number of Arrows to Burst Balloons

description: Master job sequencing with deadlines maximizing profit using greedy selection and slot filling. Learn sorting by profit deadline constraint handling. Essential for scheduling optimization deadline-driven problems. Common greedy algorithm interview question.

Master minimum platforms problem finding minimum railway platforms needed using arrival departure sorting. Learn event-based greedy counting overlapping intervals. Essential for resource allocation interval overlap counting. Common greedy interview problem.

Master gas station circular tour problem finding starting station using greedy surplus-deficit tracking. Learn total gas feasibility checking greedy starting point selection. Essential for circular array problems greedy decision making. Medium difficulty greedy problem.

Master candy distribution problem minimizing candies while satisfying rating constraints using two-pass greedy. Learn left-to-right right-to-left passes combining constraints. Essential for constraint satisfaction multi-pass greedy. Hard greedy problem testing careful analysis.

Master jump game determining reachability using greedy farthest reachable tracking. Learn maximum reach updating backward reachability checking. Essential for array reachability problems greedy optimization. Common interview question testing greedy thinking.

Master merge intervals combining overlapping intervals using sorting and greedy merging. Learn interval representation sorting by start time merging logic. Essential for calendar problems interval processing. Most common interval interview problem.

Master minimum coins problem using greedy largest denomination first for canonical coin systems. Learn when greedy works versus DP needed. Essential for understanding greedy limitations coin systems. Simple greedy problem with caveats.

Master Huffman coding building optimal prefix codes using priority queue and greedy merging. Learn frequency-based tree construction variable-length encoding. Essential for data compression understanding greedy tree construction. Advanced greedy algorithm.

Master task scheduler with cooling period using greedy most-frequent-first with idle insertion. Learn frequency counting priority queue greedy scheduling. Hard greedy problem combining frequency analysis with scheduling. Common Amazon interview question.

Master dynamic programming (DP) fundamentals and core principles. Learn how DP solves complex optimization problems by breaking them into overlapping subproblems with optimal substructure. Understand memoization (top-down recursive DP with caching) vs tabulation (bottom-up iterative DP with table filling). Essential foundation for all dynamic programming patterns including state transition, recurrence relations, and optimal solution construction.

Learn dynamic programming (DP) through the classic Fibonacci sequence. Master both DP approaches: memoization (top-down recursive DP with caching) and tabulation (bottom-up iterative DP array). Understand state definition, recurrence relations, and space optimization in dynamic programming. Fibonacci is the simplest 1D DP problem for learning state transitions and optimal substructure.

resources.title: GFG  Count Ways to Reach the Nth Stair

description: Solve the classic climbing stairs problem using dynamic programming (DP). Learn how to count paths and combinations using 1D DP state arrays. This DP problem demonstrates Fibonacci-style recurrence relations where dp[i] depends on previous states. Master state definition, transition formulas, and optimization techniques fundamental to all dynamic programming counting problems.

Maximize robbery profit using dynamic programming (DP) with constraints. Learn to handle non-adjacent selection problems using 1D DP state arrays. Master decision-making in DP: at each house, choose max(rob current + dp[i-2], skip current = dp[i-1]). Critical DP pattern for problems with mutually exclusive choices and constraint-based optimization.

Advanced dynamic programming (DP) with circular constraints. Learn to break circular dependency problems by running DP twice: once excluding first house, once excluding last house. Master advanced DP techniques for handling cyclic dependencies and boundary conditions. Essential pattern for circular array DP problems.

Master the legendary 0/1 Knapsack using 2D dynamic programming (DP). Learn bounded resource optimization where each item can be used once. Build dp[items][capacity] table with states representing maximum value achievable. Critical DP pattern for inclusion/exclusion decisions, optimal subset selection, and constraint-based optimization. Foundation for hundreds of DP problems.

resources.title: LeetCode  Partition to K Equal Sum Subsets (Similar DP profile)

description: Solve subset existence problems using dynamic programming (DP) boolean states. Learn to build dp[sum] tables tracking achievable sums. Master the subset sum DP pattern: for each element, decide include or exclude to reach target. Fundamental DP technique for partition problems, target sum problems, and subset selection optimization.

Master array partitioning using dynamic programming (DP). Learn to reduce partition problems to subset sum: if sum is odd, impossible; else find subset with sum/2 using DP. Critical application of subset DP pattern for balanced partition, equal distribution, and fairness optimization problems.

Count combinations using unbounded dynamic programming (DP). Learn the coin change DP pattern where items can be reused infinitely. Master dp[amount] state definition counting ways to make each value. Critical difference from bounded DP: iterate coins in outer loop for combinations. Essential DP pattern for counting problems with unlimited resource usage.

Minimize coin usage with dynamic programming (DP) optimization. Learn to build dp[amount] arrays tracking minimum coins for each sum. Master unbounded DP minimization: dp[i] = min(dp[i], dp[i-coin] + 1) for all coins. Critical DP pattern for resource minimization, shortest path with unlimited edges, and optimal selection problems.

Master longest increasing subsequence (LIS) using advanced dynamic programming (DP) with binary search. Learn both O(n²) DP and optimized O(n log n) patience sorting DP. Build dp[length] arrays maintaining smallest tail for each length. Critical DP pattern for sequence optimization, ordering problems, and optimal subsequence selection.

Find longest common subsequence (LCS) using 2D dynamic programming (DP) on strings. Build dp[i][j] table representing LCS length for prefixes. Learn character matching DP transitions: if s1[i]==s2[j], extend; else take max of excluding either. Foundation for diff algorithms, DNA sequencing, and string similarity DP problems.

Master edit distance (Levenshtein distance) using 2D dynamic programming (DP) for string transformation. Learn to minimize edit operations: insert, delete, replace. Build dp[i][j] table with 3 transitions per state representing operation costs. Critical DP pattern for spell checkers, DNA alignment, string similarity, and fuzzy matching algorithms.

resources.title: LeetCode  Burst Balloons (Similar MCM interval DP)

description: Master matrix chain multiplication (MCM) using interval dynamic programming (DP) with optimal partitioning. Learn dp[i][j] state representing minimum operations for subrange. Master interval DP pattern: try all split points k, combine subproblem solutions. Critical DP technique for parenthesization, expression optimization, and partition-based problems like burst balloons.

topic: DP on Grids (Unique Paths, Min Path Sum)
description: Master grid navigation using 2D dynamic programming (DP). Learn path counting (unique paths), cost minimization (min path sum), and obstacle handling. Build dp[row][col] tables with directional transitions (right, down). Critical DP pattern for grid traversal, robot navigation, and 2D optimization problems. Understand state transitions in multi-dimensional DP spaces.

resources.title: LeetCode  Bitwise AND of Numbers Range

description: Master bitwise operators AND OR XOR NOT left shift right shift for O(1) bit-level operations. Essential for optimization space-efficient algorithms. Learn bit representation two complement binary arithmetic. Foundation for bit manipulation techniques.

resources.title: GFG  Check Odd or Even Using Bitwise

description: Master checking odd even using bitwise AND with 1 in O(1) time. Learn least significant bit checking bit masking. Essential for parity checking understanding bit operations. Simple bit manipulation trick.

resources.title: LeetCode  Single Number III (bit mask usage)
GFG  Bit Masks and Bit Operations

description: Master individual bit operations get set clear toggle using bit masks and shifts. Learn creating masks manipulating specific bits. Essential for flags bitboards low-level programming. Foundation for advanced bit manipulation.

Master counting set bits (1s) using Brian Kernighan algorithm or lookup tables. Learn n AND n-1 trick for O(set bits) time. Essential for Hamming weight popcount operations. Common bit manipulation interview question.

resources.title: GFG  Power of Two Check Using Bits

description: Master checking power of two using n AND n-1 equals 0 in O(1) time. Learn single set bit detection bit patterns. Essential for binary properties understanding powers. Simple elegant bit manipulation trick.

Master finding single number among duplicates using XOR self-cancellation property. Learn XOR properties a XOR a equals 0. Essential for finding unique elements space-efficient algorithms. Most common XOR interview problem.

Master finding two single numbers using XOR partition by rightmost set bit. Learn XOR-based grouping bit manipulation partitioning. Essential for multiple unique elements advanced XOR. Medium difficulty bit manipulation problem.

resources.title: Striver  Generate All Subsets Using Bitmask

description: Master generating all subsets using bitmask iterating from 0 to 2^n-1. Learn bit representation for inclusion bit-by-bit checking. Essential for subset enumeration understanding binary counting. Elegant subset generation technique.

Master swapping numbers without temporary variable using XOR three-step swap. Learn XOR properties commutative associative. Essential for understanding XOR applications in-place operations. Classic bit manipulation trick.

Master finding missing number using XOR of all numbers and indices. Learn XOR cancellation property finding differences. Essential for array problems space-efficient solutions. Common XOR application interview question.

Master trie (prefix tree) data structure for efficient string storage and prefix-based operations. Essential for autocomplete spell checking dictionary. Learn node structure with children array or hashmap. Foundation for string algorithms.

resources.title: GFG  Insert and Search in Trie

description: Master trie insert and search operations in O(key length) time. Learn character-by-character insertion traversal word marking. Essential for dictionary implementation prefix queries. Foundation for trie operations.

resources.title: LeetCode  Implement Trie (Deletion part in logic)

description: Master trie delete operation handling prefix sharing and node cleanup. Learn recursive deletion checking child count. Essential for dynamic dictionary maintenance trie modification. Complex trie operation requiring careful handling.

Master longest prefix matching finding longest common prefix using trie traversal. Learn single-child path following prefix extraction. Essential for IP routing autocomplete. Common trie application problem.

Master word break problem checking if string can be segmented into dictionary words using trie with DP. Learn trie-based validation dynamic programming combination. Essential for string segmentation problems. Medium difficulty trie DP combination.

Master autocomplete system using trie for prefix-based word suggestions. Learn prefix search collecting all words under node. Essential for search engines type-ahead features. Practical trie application problem.

Master counting words and prefixes storing frequency counts in trie nodes. Learn augmented trie with counters prefix counting queries. Essential for word frequency prefix statistics. Common trie extension technique.

Master space-optimized trie using hashmap instead of fixed array for sparse character sets. Learn memory efficiency tradeoffs dynamic children storage. Essential for large character spaces Unicode. Practical trie optimization.

resources.title: NeetCode  Maximum XOR of Two Numbers
LeetCode  Maximum XOR of Two Numbers in an Array
GFG  Maximum XOR Pair Using Trie

description: Master maximum XOR of two numbers using binary trie storing bit representation. Learn bit-by-bit trie traversal XOR maximization greedy path selection. Hard problem combining trie with bit manipulation. Advanced trie application.

topic: Hard: Word Dictionary (Add & Search with Wildcards)

resources.title: LeetCode  Design Add and Search Words Data Structure

description: Master word dictionary with wildcard support using trie with DFS for dot matching. Learn backtracking for wildcards recursive search. Hard problem combining trie with backtracking. Advanced pattern matching application.

resources.title: NeetCode  Segment Tree Explained (Range Sum Query)

description: Master segment tree for range queries and point updates in O(log n) time. Essential for range sum min max queries. Learn binary tree structure recursive construction query merging. Foundation for advanced range query data structures.

resources.title: LeetCode  Segment Tree Node Based (Range Sum Query Mutable)

description: Master building segment tree using recursive divide-and-conquer in O(n) time. Learn bottom-up construction node value computation. Essential for segment tree initialization understanding tree structure. Foundation for segment tree operations.

resources.title: Striver  Range Sum Query using Segment Tree

description: Master range sum query using segment tree with O(log n) query time. Learn query interval decomposition partial overlap handling. Essential for efficient range queries understanding segment tree traversal. Common segment tree application.

resources.title: Striver  Point Update in Segment Tree
LeetCode  Update Operation (Range Sum Query Mutable)
GFG  Point Update in Segment Tree

description: Master point update in segment tree propagating changes up the tree in O(log n) time. Learn recursive update parent node recalculation. Essential for dynamic arrays mutable range queries. Common segment tree operation.

resources.title: Striver  Range Minimum Query using Segment Tree
NeetCode  RMQ using Segment Tree Concept
LeetCode  Range Minimum Query (Using Segment Tree / RMQ logic)
GFG  Range Minimum Query using Segment Tree

description: Master range minimum query (RMQ) using segment tree storing minimum in each node. Learn merge operation as minimum combining subranges. Essential for range minimum problems understanding segment tree variants. Common RMQ solution.

resources.title: Striver  Lazy Propagation (Range Update, Range Query)
NeetCode  Segment Tree Lazy Propagation Concept
GFG  Lazy Propagation in Segment Trees

description: Master lazy propagation for efficient range updates in O(log n) time. Learn deferring updates using lazy tags propagating when needed. Essential for range update queries efficient batch updates. Advanced segment tree technique.

topic: Segment Tree for Max Subarray Sum

resources.title: Striver  Max Subarray Sum using Segment Tree
GFG  Max Subarray Using Segment Tree

description: Master segment tree for maximum subarray sum storing prefix suffix max and total sum. Learn combining intervals with Kadane logic. Hard segment tree problem combining multiple values. Advanced segment tree application.

resources.title: LeetCode  Hard Range Update Problem (Closest to Segment Tree Beats)

description: Master segment tree beats for advanced range operations like chmin chmax with O(log n) amortized time. Learn potential function analysis lazy propagation variants. Cutting-edge segment tree technique for competitive programming. Advanced data structure research topic.

resources.title: Striver  Binary Indexed Tree (Fenwick Tree) Introduction
NeetCode  Range Sum / BIT Concept Explanation

description: Master Fenwick tree (binary indexed tree) for prefix sum queries and point updates in O(log n) time. Essential for mutable range sum queries. Learn LSB (least significant bit) based indexing cumulative frequency. Simpler alternative to segment tree for sum queries.

resources.title: LeetCode  Range Sum Query (Fenwick Build Logic)

description: Master constructing Fenwick tree using cumulative sum updates in O(n log n) time. Learn 1-based indexing parent-child relationship using LSB. Essential for BIT initialization understanding tree structure. Foundation for Fenwick operations.

topic: Range Sum Query Using Fenwick Tree

resources.title: Striver  Range Sum Query Using BIT
LeetCode  Count of Smaller Numbers After Self (BIT solution)
GFG  Range Sum Query using BIT

description: Master range sum query using Fenwick tree with prefix sum difference in O(log n) time. Learn query sum[0..r] minus sum[0..l-1] bit manipulation for parent finding. Essential for efficient range queries understanding BIT traversal. Primary Fenwick tree application.

resources.title: LeetCode  Reverse Pairs (BIT update operations used)

description: Master point update in Fenwick tree propagating to affected nodes using LSB in O(log n) time. Learn adding delta to current and parent nodes. Essential for mutable arrays dynamic cumulative operations. Common BIT operation.

topic: Range Updates and Range Queries (Fenwick Tree 2D Variant)

resources.title: LeetCode  2D Range Sum Query (2D Fenwick Tree equivalent)
GFG  Range Update and Range Query Using BIT

description: Master 2D Fenwick tree and range update techniques for matrix queries and batch updates. Learn 2D extension difference array technique. Essential for 2D range queries advanced BIT applications. Advanced Fenwick tree usage.

Master hashing fundamentals hash functions load factor collision resolution for O(1) average time operations. Essential for fast lookups frequency counting. Learn open addressing chaining rehashing. Foundation for hash-based data structures.

Master frequency counting using hashmap storing element counts for O(n) analysis. Essential for majority element anagrams frequency-based problems. Learn counter patterns most common element finding. Most common hashmap application.

Master two sum problem using hashmap for O(n) solution storing complements. Learn one-pass hashmap target-complement pattern. Essential for pair finding sum-based problems. Most famous hashmap interview question.

Master anagram detection using character frequency hashmap or sorted string as key. Learn grouping strings by signature. Essential for group anagrams valid anagram problems. Common string hashing pattern.

resources.title: NeetCode  Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
LeetCode  Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
GFG  Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters

description: Master longest substring without repeating characters using sliding window with hashmap. Learn tracking last occurrence window adjustment. Essential for substring problems character tracking. Common sliding window hashmap combination.

Master subarray sum equals k using prefix sum with hashmap for O(n) solution. Learn storing cumulative sums checking sum-k existence. Essential for subarray problems prefix sum technique. Advanced hashmap application.

Master group anagrams using sorted string or frequency tuple as hashmap key. Learn anagram signature generation grouping by key. Essential for string classification problems. Common interview question.

Master frequency windows using hashmap for character counting in sliding window problems. Learn valid substring detection pattern matching. Essential for window-based string problems. Advanced sliding window technique.

Master custom hash function design collision handling using chaining or open addressing. Learn hash function properties universal hashing. Essential for understanding hash table internals. Advanced hashing topic.

Master designing HashMap from scratch using array buckets with linked list chaining. Learn resize strategy load factor management. Essential for data structure design understanding hash tables deeply. Common system design question.
